intro: Simaba bidwillii, commonly known as the Bidwill’s mahogany, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the coastal regions of eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes many aromatic and economically important plants. The tree is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and lance-shaped leaves that are often aromatic when crushed. Its small, white flowers are followed by woody, egg-shaped fruits containing edible seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
